definition: occurrence (refers to time and place esp. of a criminal act)/to take place/to occur/to advertise freelance work
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: In recent years, the crime of swindling credit cards is on the rise.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，信用卡诈骗发案率呈上升趋势。

sentences.english: The bill was paid, and the woman was entirely satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 该发案的薪水时，和那个女人是完全满意。

definition: to investigate (as detective)/to solve (crime)/to uncover (a plot)/to sniff out/to break in and analyze/detective work/to scout
to investigate a crime on the spot/to occur (of a crime)/to be discovered (of a crime)
to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to solve a case/shabby old table
to deploy surveillance/to put under surveillance
to order the return of stolen goods
